CONDITIONS & FORECAST

It should be another sunny day above the valley cloud. A slow cooling trend will be happening over the next 24 hrs with some snow in the forecast for the weekend. There will likely be a thin crust on solar aspects, but the Northerly bowls in the alpine will be the best snow today. Have a good day.

Backcountry Conditions

Watch for variable conditions on Southerly aspects today with the Northerlies being the best skiing. The avalanche danger should decrease over the short term but still use caution as you asses the stability of the upper snowpack. Go to avalanche.ca for more details.

Alpine forecast provided by RWDI - a meteorological consulting and engineering firm with extensive experience in microclimate and mountain meteorology.

The initial data for this forecast is extracted from the leading US regional (WRF NAM, short term) and global (GFS, long term) weather models four times daily and post-processed by RWDI to account for the unique environment near Revelstoke.

Today

Fog
Fog dissipating late this morning then cloudy except sunny above the valley cloud. Temperature steady near plus 3. UV index 1 or low.

Tonight

A few wet flurries
Cloudy. A few wet flurries beginning before morning. Fog patches developing near midnight. Temperature steady near zero.

Saturday

A few rain showers or wet flurries
A few wet flurries changing to a few rain showers in the morning. Snow level rising to 1300 metres in the afternoon. Fog patches dissipating early in the morning. Wind becoming southeast 20 km/h gusting to 40 near noon. High plus 4.

Safety & Risk Awareness

Skiing, snowboarding, biking, and other activities involve the risk of injury. All users should become familiar with the risks, dangers, and hazards that may be encountered with these activities.

Learn more about Safety & Risk Awareness
